org.kepler.bio.stratosphere.input

Class FASTAInputFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.stratosphere.api.common.io.FileInputFormat<eu.stratosphere.types.Record>
      • eu.stratosphere.api.java.record.io.FileInputFormat
        • org.kepler.bio.stratosphere.input.FASTAInputFormat
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    eu.stratosphere.api.common.io.InputFormat<eu.stratosphere.types.Record,eu.stratosphere.core.fs.FileInputSplit>, java.io.Serializable

    public class FASTAInputFormat
extends eu.stratosphere.api.java.record.io.FileInputFormat
    This Input Format is to read fasta sequence file and generate key value pair records. The format of each key is : partitionNumber_(readPosIndex+start) and each value is a list of sequences. Parameter 'KEPLER::parameter::SequenceNumberPerExecution' specify at most how many sequences will be put into each record. This Input Format can guarantee each sequence is read in a whole and each record won't have truncated sequences. It is built based on eu.stratosphere.pact.common.io.TextInputFormat class.
    Author:
    Jianwu Wang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
